snippet: Despite a slump in global sales of personal computers, the company said its software product sales drove the increase, which exceeded Wall Street estimates.
abstract: Microsoft reports third-quarter net income of $6.06 billion, or 72 cents a share, up from $5.11 billion, or 60 cents a share in same period year earlier; growth, fueled by sales from Windows and Office software products, exceeds analyst expectations; revenue rose 18 percent to $20.49 billion from $17.41 billion.
lead_paragraph: Despite a slump in global sales of personal computers, the company said its software product sales drove the increase, which exceeded Wall Street estimates.

headline.main: Software Sales Bolster Microsoft, Leading to a 19% Rise in Profit
headline.print_headline: Software Sales Bolster Microsoft, Leading to a 19% Rise in Profit
